content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

The main image shows two distinct structures made of various building blocks:

## Structure 1 (Left):
- Total blocks: 7
- Layers: 3
- Description: A small structure with a red arch base, supporting a yellow platform with green and blue blocks, topped with an orange triangular roof.

## Structure 2 (Right):
- Total blocks: 7 
- Layers: 4
- Description: A more complex structure with a yellow base, two orange cylindrical pillars, another yellow platform, a red house-like top with an arch opening, and orange triangular roof pieces.

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

For Structure 1 (Left, from bottom to top):
- Block #2 (red arch)
- Block #14 (red cube on left side)
- Block #10 (yellow rectangular platform)
- Block #6 (green cube) - used twice
- Block #9 (blue vertical rectangle)
- Block #15 (orange triangular roof)

For Structure 2 (Right, from bottom to top):
- Block #10 (yellow rectangular platform) - used twice (for base and middle)
- Block #12 (orange cylinder) - used twice
- Block #3 (red arch piece)
- Block #14 (red cube)
- Block #15 and #16 (orange triangular roof pieces)

# Assembly Instructions

```
{
  Step1: Move block with index 2
  Step2: Move block with index 14
  Step3: Move block with index 10
  Step4: Move block with index 6
  Step5: Move block with index 6
  Step6: Move block with index 9
  Step7: Move block with index 15
  Step8: Move block with index 10
  Step9: Move block with index 12
  Step10: Move block with index 12
  Step11: Move block with index 10
  Step12: Move block with index 3
  Step13: Move block with index 14
  Step14: Move block with index 15
  Step15: Move block with index 16
}
```

This assembly order constructs the left structure first (steps 1-7) followed by the right structure (steps 8-15), working from the bottom layer upward for each.
